extraction_metadata.notes: Comprehensive 5-page trial record with detailed witness testimonies (14 witnesses), clear timeline, confession under torture, and death sentence. Notable for: extensive testimony about refusals of alms/resources precipitating harms; Daniel de Fricourt case with detailed illness narrative including doctor's advice and pilgrimage; pattern of animal deaths following quarrels; expulsion from Eumont as vagabond witch; confession immediately after torture approved; unable to name accomplices at sabbat; executed by Change de Nancy. Prosecutor Rémy prominent in requesting torture and death sentence. Case shows economic marginality (begging, vagrancy) and social exclusion as key factors. Multiple witnesses corroborate patterns of quarrel-refusal-harm.
